Prefs.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   Prefs.h
00006 
00007   Dominic Mazzoni
00008   Markus Meyer
00009 
00010   Audacity uses wxWindows' wxFileConfig class to handle preferences.
00011   In Audacity versions prior to 1.3.1, it used wxConfig, which would
00012   store the prefs in a platform-dependent way (e.g. in the registry
00013   on Windows). Now it always stores the settings in a configuration file
00014   in the Audacity Data Directory.
00015 
00016   Every time we read a preference, we need to specify the default
00017   value for that preference, to be used if the preference hasn't
00018   been set before.
00019 
00020   So, to avoid code duplication, we provide functions in this file
00021   to read and write preferences which have a nonobvious default
00022   value, so that if we later want to change this value, we only
00023   have to change it in one place.
00024 
00025   See Prefs.cpp for a (complete?) list of preferences we keep
00026   track of...
00027 
00028 **********************************************************************/
00029 #ifndef __AUDACITY_PREFS__
00030 #define __AUDACITY_PREFS__
00031 
00032 #include "Audacity.h"
00033 
00034 #include <wx/config.h>
00035 #include <wx/fileconf.h>
00036 
00037 void InitPreferences();
00038 void FinishPreferences();
00039 
00040 extern AUDACITY_DLL_API wxFileConfig *gPrefs;
00041 extern int gMenusDirty;
00042 
00043 #endif
